DataElement.preferredName: Intervention Trial Study Protocol Document Design Pattern Code DesignConfigurationType
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of data._The act of working out the form of something (as by making a sketch or outline or plan) or the result of this activity.:A distinctive style or form of something, the characteristic set of traits or actions or qualities of a group, person, or thing, as behavior patterns; in molecular biology: a nucleic acid or protein motif that is computationally detectable within aligned sequences.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation._The code that describes the clinical trial pattern developed to compare treatment groups in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intervention Trial Study Protocol Document Design Pattern Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of data._The act of working out the form of something (as by making a sketch or outline or plan) or the result of this activity.:A distinctive style or form of something, the characteristic set of traits or actions or qualities of a group, person, or thing, as behavior patterns; in molecular biology: a nucleic acid or protein motif that is computationally detectable within aligned sequences.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of data.

Concepts.definition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of working out the form of something (as by making a sketch or outline or plan) or the result of this activity.:A distinctive style or form of something, the characteristic set of traits or actions or qualities of a group, person, or thing, as behavior patterns; in molecular biology: a nucleic acid or protein motif that is computationally detectable within aligned sequences.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: The act of working out the form of something (as by making a sketch or outline or plan) or the result of this activity.
An arrangement of objects, facts, behaviors, or other things which have scientific, mathematical, geometric, statistical, or other meaning.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/7/11 - no longer used by BRIDG; released for reuse by COPPA

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The code that describes the clinical trial pattern developed to compare treatment groups in a clinical trial.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of clinical study in which each study subject receives the same series of treatments but in a random order that differs across arms of the study. Each subject serves as their own control in this type of study.

Concepts.definition: A type of clinical study in which each study subject receives the same series of treatments but in a random order that differs across arms of the study. Each subject serves as their own control in this type of study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of clinical study in which two or more treatments are given alone and in combination, such that all possible combinations are represented across the treatment arms, and are compared in parallel against the study control group.

Concepts.definition: A type of clinical study in which two or more treatments are given alone and in combination, such that all possible combinations are represented across the treatment arms, and are compared in parallel against the study control group.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of clinical study in which subjects are assigned to one of two treatment arms at the beginning of the trial and continue in that arm throughout the length of the trial. Study subjects are only exposed to the treatment that is assigned to the particular study arm they are enrolled in.

Concepts.definition: A type of clinical study in which subjects are assigned to one of two treatment arms at the beginning of the trial and continue in that arm throughout the length of the trial. Study subjects are only exposed to the treatment that is assigned to the particular study arm they are enrolled in.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of clinical study in which there is only one treatment arm available to all study participants.

Concepts.definition: A type of clinical study in which there is only one treatment arm available to all study participants.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
